X.name: Pauli X gate
X.description: Pauli X gate (π rotation over X-axis) classical computing equivalent: "NOT" gate.

Y.name: Pauli Y gate
Y.description: Pauli Y gate (π rotation over Y-axis) classical computing equivalent: "NOT" gate.

Z.name: Pauli Z gate
Z.description: Pauli Z gate (π rotation over Z-axis) classical computing equivalent: "NOT" gate.

RX.name: Rotated Pauli X gate
RX.description: RX (Rotated Pauli X gate) is a single-qubit rotation through an angle of π/2 around the x-axis.

RY.name: Rotated Pauli Y gate
RY.description: RY (Rotated Pauli Y gate) is a single-qubit rotation through an angle of π/2 around the y-axis.

RZ.name: Rotated Pauli Z gate
RZ.description: RZ (Rotated Pauli Z gate) is a single-qubit rotation through an angle of π/2 around the z-axis.

H.name: Hadamard gate
H.description: One qubit rotation, mapping the two qubit- basis states to two superposition states.

CNOT.name: Controlled NOT gate
CNOT.description: CNOT or (Controlled Pauli-X) acts on 2 or more qubits.

Measurement Gate.name: Measurement gate
Measurement Gate.description: Used to observe the quantum state.
